data.description: About the Role As a Product Manager Intern, you will drive strategy, vision, and execution for complex platform initiatives that operate at internet scale. This role requires balancing user experience, technical scalability, regulatory compliance, and cross-functional alignment. You will define product roadmaps, shape core capabilities, and ensure the delivery of innovative, developer-friendly solutions that enable trusted digital experiences across industries. This is a high-impact internship where you’ll influence long-term platform evolution, work closely with stakeholders across engineering, design, data, and compliance, and serve as a key voice in shaping how products deliver trust, security, and usability at scale. This role is based out of our Mountain View, CA or McLean, VA offices and requires full-time in-office attendance. Responsibilities Strategy & Vision: Define and champion the product vision and strategy, aligning business needs with technical execution and long-term platform goals. Roadmap & Execution: Build and prioritize roadmaps, translating complex requirements into clear deliverables that improve scalability, compliance, and user experience. Product Leadership: Partner with cross-functional teams to translate market, customer, and regulatory requirements into impactful product capabilities. Ecosystem & Partnerships: Develop integrations and frameworks that expand use cases, support interoperability, and enhance ecosystem adoption. Stakeholder Management: Communicate product direction, trade-offs, and progress to leadership and cross-functional partners, building alignment and momentum. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience). 3+ years of product management experience, ideally in platforms, identity systems, or regulated domains. Technical fluency in APIs, data modeling, and scalable architectures. Familiarity with relevant regulatory or compliance frameworks. Proven ability to set vision, manage complexity, and drive products from concept through delivery. Strong communicator able to influence across technical and executive audiences. Why This Role This role offers the opportunity to shape foundational capabilities that power secure, scalable, and user-centric digital experiences. As a Staff Product Manager, you will operate at the intersection of technology, trust, and innovation—helping define the future of digital identity and platform solutions.
requirements: Roadmap & Execution: Build and prioritize roadmaps, translating complex requirements into clear deliverables that improve scalability, compliance, and user experience.
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of product management experience, ideally in platforms, identity systems, or regulated domains.
